fEndSlope

protected float fEndSlope
Italic slope of end character (e.g. if the character has width 100, height 10, and italic slope 0.5 then it is considered to extend to 100,0 but only to 95,10 (the bottom edge ends (italic slope) * (height) pixels left)

internalInit

protected void internalInit(org.w3c.dom.Element e)
                     throws EquationFormatException
Initialise based on any necessary parameters from the element. Children are are already set up and inited; parents are set up, but not inited. Default does nothing.

Parameters:
e - Element matching this item
Throws:
EquationFormatException - If anything is wrong with the definition

useAdvanceAfter

public boolean useAdvanceAfter(om.equation.Item iBefore)
Override to indicate that the previous item's advance width, not width, should be used when positioning this item.

Parameters:
iBefore - Item before this one
Returns:
True if previous item's advance width should be used

isWhitespaceBefore

public boolean isWhitespaceBefore()
Returns:
True if there was whitespace before this item in the equation and it therefore shouldn't coagulate with anything before

convertTextSize

public int convertTextSize(int iTextSize)
Converts a constant to an actual pixel size. (Note that if equations are being scaled for accessibility, the graphics context will be scaled when drawn, so we don't need to use different sizes here.)

Parameters:
iTextSize - TEXTSIZE_xxx constant
Returns:
Actual size in pixels

decreaseTextSize

public static int decreaseTextSize(int iTextSize)
Obtains a smaller text size, but only if we haven't run out of the range.

Parameters:
iTextSize - Current size
Returns:
One size smaller (or same if smallest)

A suitable gap for use as spacing of some sort
